website_summaries.verdict: It isn't the most supportive sports bra in the world, but it's budget-friendly and seems to hold up well over time.
pros: Generates praise for its comfortable elastic and free-moving racerback design
cons: This sports bra runs quite small
Most consumers need to go up at least one size to ensure a comfortable fit for sports

customer_reviews.title: Know what you need!!!
customer_reviews.text: This sports bra is awesome!! In the reviews it said to order up so I ordered a medium, but it came to large. I think people are getting confused on what kind of bra this is. It's a HIGH impact bra. It's supposed to be difficult to get on and smash everything into place so it doesn't move. I had to send it back and get the small. I'm 5 feet and wear a 32DD bra and the small fits perfect and works exactly like it should for my fitness needs.
customer_reviews.author: Brent B.

customer_reviews.title: Way too small!!
customer_reviews.text: This is listed as XL. I have another Champion bra I purchased a while back that's an XL and is sized to fit. This bra is significantly smaller. I have been waiting to see if it would stretch, and it has not. I held them up to each other, and this one is clearly smaller (by 2 inches when one is laying on top of the other). I measured this one, and it is only 14 inches across, meaning it is only 28 inches around. It's labeled as XL, but it's size is more of a medium. Too bad it's too late to get my money back!!
customer_reviews.author: Litgirl

customer_reviews.title: Snug fitting bra for sports
customer_reviews.text: This bra is the keeper of the boobs!!! Basically no bounce, no movement! The only problem is that there isn't any padding which will lead to some awkward moments unless you have a tank top and shirt or a thick shirt. So I always wear a tank top over this bra and then I have my shirt...since it is a very snug fitting bra, it does leave marks on my shoulders and ribcage. So be careful in sizing so you can actually take off the bra at the end of the day!
customer_reviews.author: A. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Solid Choice
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bra that would offer me enough support to jog/run a few times a week. This fits that bill. I am 5'5" and weigh 145lbsand a 36C. I ordered a medium and it fits snuggly but not so much so that I can't breath or it's uncomfortable. The fabric is soft and breathable. It is quite thin, so it offers little protection from showing that your chilly, but it holds my girls in place and for the price I'd say it is more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Quality bra for smaller busts.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 32B, and this fit great. I would imagine that women with larger busts would need more support for exercises like running though. I love it and wear it regularly. It’s a quality basic bra and hasn’t let me down. I use it for all activities at the gym, especially long distance running. I don’t mind the lack of padding, but some women might.
customer_reviews.author: Alex O

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing among colors - many are too small!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Champion sports bras.. BUT what the heck is up with their inconsistent sizing?! It seems like every color is sized differently. I have a moderate sized bust (34-36C) and if I order size Large in black, it fits fine, but ALL of the brightly colored ones I've ordered are much too tight. This is supposed to be size LARGE and my chest isn't even that dang big. C'mon Champion, get it together! Overall, the bras (when the correct size) are comfortable, but I can't recommend them to anyone who doesn't have lots of spare time to spend sending them back if the fit is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jenom

customer_reviews.title: The minus about the bra may have turned out to be a plus...
customer_reviews.text: The product description is lacking. When I received it the manufacturer tags state the the bra is constructed to provide "medium support." In other words, they only recommend you use it for low impact activities, such as walking, yoga, or pilates. I'm glad I ordered my regular size and that it runs small. The tight fit happens to mimic that high-maximum support I need for running. Anyhow, my suggestion to whomever writes up the product descriptions is to include the level of support so that women are able to use the sports bra that fits the activity they intend to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: BettyCan

customer_reviews.title: Great if you order big enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a size 4 and ended up with a size large, so when everyone says it runs small, IT RUNS SMALL. However, once I worked out the size, it's a great sports bra. I initially thought, "how small can a medium be?" and ordered the medium. Which I kept (not worth the hassle of sending back) but have to struggle into it. Once on, it is fine. But I prefer the large which also seems to fit just fine when it is on --- and I can get in on without feeling like a contortionist. That said, certainly holds everything securely :-)
customer_reviews.author: lheath

customer_reviews.title: ORDER UP: RUNS SMALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: I should have spent more time on the reviews rather than trusting my usual Champion size. At a 36 C I bought a medium and was sorely disappointed. I generally prefer a tight and well supported fit, but Champion does this infinitely better in other models, such as its seamless options or vented options. The material didn't particularly impress me. I'm not convinced that a larger size would be more comfortable. The band is thin and unforgiving and the top lacks any contouring whatsoever. Perhaps I would wear this if my goal was to eliminate the ladies all together, but I don't think I would recommend it to anyone more busty than a "b" . . .
customer_reviews.author: Anisaze

customer_reviews.title: I call this my “locked and loaded” bra
customer_reviews.text: So this bra is great if you’re looking for compression, not cute. This thing is all business. I’m a 34D and this almost flattens me, so pretty impressive. Good for running, anything high intensity. I’ve had it a few years and it’s still in good shape after many washes and wears. The elastic doesn’t cut into my back fat and the material is comfortable, I never have a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: just ok..only medium support
customer_reviews.text: I wear 34DDD and I bought a large. The right size...the girls both fit tho a bit squashed...couldn't go larger becuz the band around would be loose. Gave 3 stars becuz i wanted better support. More a medium support bra and Definitely not for running or high impact sports. Ok for walking and workout. Don't like the elastic band that goes around...don't think it will last. My other sport bras have much better quality elastic which gives better support...but I guess u get what u pay for
customer_reviews.author: Ark angel

customer_reviews.title: Great Bra but Beware - Runs VERY Small!
customer_reviews.text: Champion Sports bras are great quality and high support. They are also reasonably priced in comparison to other bras of similar quality. Just remember they run VERY small. Be sure to order a size up from what you think you should be. I'm a 32B and every other brand of sports bra I've ever worn I've gotten a small. However, I purchased a Champion sports bra in a small earlier this year and couldn't even get it on! I ordered this in a medium and it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Good bra/good price
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these now. My bra size is 34D. I bought these in XL, they fit great. I didn't give 5 stars because in all honesty I could 'held in' a little more. But it does say medium hold on the description. That might just be a preference because I love when my breast stay (no moving whatsoever) in place when I'm doing lots of jumping during a cardio class for e.g. Don't get me wrong...it is decent With that being said, I would buy more:-)
customer_reviews.author: Jae S

customer_reviews.title: snug and cozy wins the push-up race.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 34B, so not a lot to write home about. Once, when I was in my teens, a Victoria Secrets salesgal tried to help me in that department, but I eschewed the sea of padding for something more natural, which they didn't have. "Well then, come back when you're ready to be a woman," she said testily. With this sports bra, which is not padded but still shields the nips, I can confidently return to this same gal, punch her in the face, and declare that I'm a woman now.
customer_reviews.author: bellazirka

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 5 ⭐️
customer_reviews.text: The first time I wore this sports bra I loved the fit but just after the first wash ( cold ) it become super tight I could barely breathe. Totally not worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Aadit

customer_reviews.title: For all action sports
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly supportive, somewhat snug. Love the patterns and quality of these sports bras. Having bought over 20 different kinds of sports bras over my life, these are the rare ones that can handle long runs and Zumba classes with C cups. Other reviews mentioned color bleeding, but I haven't experienced anything despite ordering several: black, grey, camoflague, and bright pink. At last count, I now own 8 of these bras.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Yucky product - Not made like before!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this bra. I was hoping to find the ones I have from a long time ago made of mostly cotton and feels like you're not wearing anything. These are like wearing a rubber band. When did America's clothing all turn to spandex, polyester, and dry fit? Obviously, the manufacturers/designers do not work out. Dry fit, polyester, and spandex DOES NOT BREATH!!!! It's like wearing a hot house. BRING BACK COTTON!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CNINGHM

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 34A and bought 2 mediums in both the black and the charcoal grey and they all fit well. They are SLIGHTLY too long but I have a short torso and I know a small would suffocate me. With these lil tatas, it's not easy finding a sports bra that's snug in the bust without chaffing off your underarms region haha! I will definitely buy again and start branching out into the super fun colors!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Decent price for Nike-comparable quality!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great support for such a low price compared to other top brands like nike. It's almost exactly the same as a similar bra I have from them and less than half the price. It does fit a little smaller than I'd expect, though it is a sport bra and compression is the name of the game. I'd not say it's comfortable and my biggest problem is that the lower band always flips up folded in half, probably because it's too small. I'll definitely order again, though a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't run *too* small
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 32/34 DDD, and after reading reviews that it runs small I decided to order a Large. It fits snug and is comfortable for sleeping in, but doesn't keep things in place enough for high-impact activities so I'll be ordering a Medium as well. If you're doing yoga, weights, or stationary bike, probably order a size up for comfort; but if you're running, jumping, or doing dance aerobics, I'd recommend ordering your usual size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for minimizing and coverage...
customer_reviews.text: This sports bra does the job of compression and holding everything in place (I ordered a Large). I am a 32DD and battle with finding active wear that is small enough to fit me around the band yet is large enough to keep everything covered. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is I find the fabric a little swim-suit like, but a minor detail I really do not mind. Overall, I like it and would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: DrPuff

customer_reviews.title: I feel like it's one of the most sturdy sports bras I've ...
customer_reviews.text: The colors are bright, and the construction is really solid. I feel like it's one of the most sturdy sports bras I've ever owned! Still... It runs small, so definitely order at least one size up. I tend to have a bigger chest, so I ordered a large. I could've easily gone with an extra large or XXL. It's a tight squeeze. Holds up very well to washing, and I have not noticed the fabric fading at all.
customer_reviews.author: ASweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Runs Small, But Love the Fit
customer_reviews.text: These run small, maybe more than a full size. They are still probably my favorite sports bra. I am a 34 & barely a B cup. I should easily fit into a Small. Instead, I snugly fit into a Medium. Once I got the right fit, the sports bra is extremely comfortable and stays in place. I especially like that it high on the sides; very supportive. Because the Medium is snug on me, it feels like a little more than Medium support. I can jog in it. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: UniqueNickname

customer_reviews.title: They do make me feel super flat chested more then usual
customer_reviews.text: There are not at all as sizing chart shows. I'd order a size up next time but I'm not returning because I plan on losing weight so they will fit one day. Its hard to get shoulders in them and to get back out of. Material does not give stretch. I'm a 130lbs 5ft wear a 34b bra size and ordered a medium I should have got a large. They are sitting in my drawer till I could for in them. They do make me feel super flat chested more then usual.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Michaelson

customer_reviews.title: Black Size Small Review
customer_reviews.text: All of my champion sports bras are a Size Small but some strange reason this fits smaller than the rest. It has a lot of compression for a size Small. I kind of don't mind it cuz that way my breasts are latched to my body while I'm running. The only issue is getting it off over my shoulders. I'm a 34C. I would probably recommend to other women the same bra size as I am to go up to a medium with this bra if you don't want to feel restricted. It's all a personal preference really.
customer_reviews.author: td22

customer_reviews.title: Good sports bra for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a decent sports bra. After reading some of the reviews, it is recommended you buy one size up. I'm usually a medium but because they run a little small I purchased a large. Good thing I listened to some of the other reviewers because otherwise the bra would have been too small. It washes well and dries quick. It does a good job of keeping the girls in place. I'm a C cup and find the medium support more than adequate for power walking or running on the treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Mys17

customer_reviews.title: Overall awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: Listen to all the reviews and order one size up than usual. I normally wear nike sports bras size Large and ordered a XL in this bra because it's an awesome price. This is a medium impact bra per the tag that came on it. However, I have been using mine for light jogging and occasional sprinting (I normally wear size 36DD at Vicki Secret) and this sports bra in size XL does the job perfectly. Only one weird comment, not even a complaint because it's not that bad: The bra, even after one washing, smells funny a tad. If weird smells bother you a ton...be warry lol Arrived in two days as promised. Happy Customer
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I don't feel it runs small
customer_reviews.text: This sports bra is pretty good overall. However, I don't feel it runs as small as everyone says. I'm a 34C and always buy a small, because if it's tight, it holds better. However, after reading the reviews, I decided to order a size up. I will be ordering in the future, a small. I'm giving this 4 stars because the delivery sucked. It was prime, and they gave the package to my neighbors a few doors down. I had never spoken to them, but thank god they were kind enough to give it to me. I know this isn't the sellers fault, but just sharing my experience
customer_reviews.author: rosangelaaaa

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the girls in check
customer_reviews.text: These run small! But that is sort of a bonus because they also keep your chest from hitting you in the face if you're a DD like me. I would probably need an XL to be able to wear it all day, but for a few hours, a L holds it all together for me. They're very well made. I have 5 now and I love them a lot. For low impact, with large breasts, go up a couple of sizes- for high impact, only go about one size up.
customer_reviews.author: FatKidMafia007

customer_reviews.title: LOVED IT, BUT
customer_reviews.text: It was like a DOLL size extra small fit, that no one could use. The quality of this was really good I wish it could of been used. Buy it if it fits you seems like a good boobie sock :P
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Decent Bra, Sizes Run Small
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a totally acceptable sports bra if the sizing were accurate. I am a 38DD and normally wear an XL in Champion sports bras, which is what I ordered. When I tried it on, though, the bra was really tight, which I'm fine with because tight bras tend to provide more support. However, this bra did not provide suitable coverage and I was spilling out the top of it. Had to send it back due to the size running small. If they had an XXL, I'd be happy to order a size up, but either Amazon doesn't carry that size or Champion doesn't make it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen F.

customer_reviews.title: No support.
customer_reviews.text: So my review was hidden by a "sensitivity filter" and there was nothing sensitive about my review. Other then maybe the manufacturer or seller got sedative about my review. Bra is junk. The other one they had was better, thicker, more support. This one is super thin.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Too small...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item without reading the reviews, only to find that several others had the same issue as myself. I am 5'4" and weigh 128lbs... wearing a size 4-6, I naturally assumed that a medium would be more than optimal... perhaps even a tad loose. Much to my chagrin, when the item arrived I could not put it on. The sizes run very small. I returned it for an X-Large, which actually fits well... it is well constructed and has survived many washes, and for this reason I give the 3-star rating instead of 1-star.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa M

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this sports bra
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this sports bra. I have bought Champion sports bras before from our local Kohl's store but now they have decided to not supply this product for purchase. I was very disappointed when I thought I had purchased the same style and kind as before, but that is the problem with on-line purchases...you can't see the actual product. Will be giving this to my granddaughter or Goodwill. Not worth my time and money to send back.
customer_reviews.author: granny

customer_reviews.title: I ordered one size up
customer_reviews.text: Its ok , I usually wear L on my , but after reading reviews from other buyers so I took the advice and I ordered one size up. I used this bra for small impact exercise that I don't have to jump or bounce a lot, like weights or body pump, i tried it for jogging but the chicks bounce quite a bit... so i dont used for it however I feel ok wearing it for zumba. I really like the color, the material is the expected . I am pleased with the purchase , it arrived on time and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Carms

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: excellent support. a lot easier to get on than it is to get off... there is no give to this baby so pulling it off is an act of contortionism. Perfect for a runner or other really, really high impact athlete. For me, for the future, I'm going to stick to ones with more stretch for easier on/off or ones that have a front or back closure... having to dang near dislocate your shoulder to get out of a sports bra after walk/jogging 5 miles is nonsense... however, if I were a diehard runner I think I'd be singing a different tune.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for trans guy on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I'm an ftm trans guy in high school and this is good for a binding alternative during gym class. My underbust is 30" and I ordered a Small. The band is a little tight and rolls up sometimes. Otherwise, it fits perfect. Of course it's definitely doesn't flatten the chest as much as a real binder, but it looks fine with an oversized t-shirt. Perfect for those who can't buy a fancy $40 compression bra.
customer_reviews.author: snazzylizardz

customer_reviews.title: Great low impact sports bra
customer_reviews.text: Great basic sports bra. Doesn't even do the uniboob squish. It actually gives me nice cleavage, which is unheard of for a sports bra The material is very silky and comfortable. I am 5'9", 170, and normally wear a 34F bra. I ordered the XL, and it fits great. I was looking for a low impact sports bra for doing yoga, this works really good. I also ordered a medium for my daughter who is 5'4", 115lb, and a 34B, it's a great fit for her, as well, so happy all around.
customer_reviews.author: Jerritt C. Dayhoff

customer_reviews.title: I like it but it is a little smaller than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6" 145lbs with 36C and I bought this in a large. It definitely supports you, but after my workout I can't wait to get it off because it is a little too tight for my liking. I'm hoping that after a few wears that it might stretch out a bit or I might lose enough weight to have it fit more comfortably. I do have somewhat broad shoulders and this might be aiding in the discomfort as I feel it pulling down on my shoulders. It is made well and does the job. I will not give up on this bra just yet since it was a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: ValPem

customer_reviews.title: More like my back and under arms are sore from it ...
customer_reviews.text: 1 ordered up a size and got the XL, I usually wear a size L in sports bras (size 38C in bras) and it still feels very tight, and not in the supportive way. More like my back and under arms are sore from it being too tight after working a few hours. I got the black one, it's completely opaque and hasn't left any marks from the dye.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Order one size up
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size medium in sports bras. I got a size large for this bra and it fits perfectly. It's very supportive, yet doesn't constrict my breathing. I'm 5'11", 135 pounds, and a 32C. The straps are actually long enough that the bra doesn't go into my armpits, and the material for the white color is very soft, yet supportive. I highly recommend this bra. I'm replacing all my other sports bras with this bra in multiple colors.
customer_reviews.author: Arlyn

customer_reviews.title: it squeezes my ribs so tight I feel like I cannot breathe and then I have to ask ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in a large (based off the size chart) and it absolutely does not fit. If I manage to get it over my head, it squeezes my ribs so tight I feel like I cannot breathe and then I have to ask for my boyfriends help to get it off. If you are looking to purchase, I would recommend buying two sizes up from what the size chart recommends.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: The Large is Extremely Small
customer_reviews.text: I'm of average build - somewhat flat-chested - so I thought this particular sports bra would fit comfortably enough if I purchased a medium. Then, I read the sizing chart indicating that it fits on the small side and to order one size up. I did that, ordering a Large. Even a Large is teeny. Oh, it definitely gives me all-around support, but getting into and out of the bra can be a bit of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Latson

customer_reviews.title: Not so champion
customer_reviews.text: The Champion logo and the Curves logo looked quite similar, except Curves is in color, I concluded that one must have bought the other. The Champion elastic band tends to curve upward. it's either too wide or not set well like that of Curves. Also I noticed that Champion straps pull your neck and shoulders forward. I've owned my Curves for eight years and they still work for me. Why didn't I return Champion? I was off for a 10-day vacation.
customer_reviews.author: la paloma

customer_reviews.title: I bought like 3 more after my first one
customer_reviews.text: I bought like 3 more after my first one. Great fit and holds the girls in place. I know that some women look for the perfect sports bra to keep the bewbs in check and make them look shapely all the time. Look. I've been teaching aerobics for over 10 years. The only thing that I want a sports bra to do is to keep them from flopping around. This bra does just that. Bravo. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia L. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: large sports bra's usually work fine, so I bought an XL since reviews say ...
customer_reviews.text: I sized up and this still felt a size too small. I'm a 38DD, large sports bra's usually work fine, so I bought an XL since reviews say it fits small. Waaaay small. My skin gets irritated quickly by the rubbing/digging from the straps since it barely fits. I'm just going to go back to Moving Comfort for sports bras. It's a little more money, but they fit well and are very well made.
customer_reviews.author: A. Emery

customer_reviews.title: Runs small but good qualtlity
customer_reviews.text: I saw other reviews that said it ran small, but I thought that would be good, as I really LIKE the girls to be held down as still as possible. I can get it on and it feels fine for a while, but the band underneath is where the tightness really gets you after a time. A good quality bra otherwise, just really, trust us and go a size larger than it says you need.
customer_reviews.author: Wren MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Runs way too small
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time that I have ordered a Champion bra on Amazon and it has been too small. I ordered XL for 38C. It has been awhile since I bought a Champion sports bra, but I had comfortably fit into a large. The last Champion sports bra I bought on Amazon was a large, so I thought surely if I bought a size bigger, it would fit. When I first tried it on, I thought that it would be okay, but after wearing it all day, my skin hurt. Not going to try anymore Champion bras.
customer_reviews.author: Yeasayer

customer_reviews.title: The straps are too skinny to do anything especially useful. The cut is much lower than it appears ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. The straps are too skinny to do anything especially useful. The cut is much lower than it appears in the picture. Because the straps do nada, the full weight of things rests on the chest band, which proceeds to give you the equivalent of generally uncomfortable muffin top. Might be good for a skinny person who just wants a bra for around the house, but otherwise, not useful.
customer_reviews.author: Rala

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product! Not just for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product! Not just for the price, but in general. I wouldn't be able to tell it's only $10. It is tight, as a sports bra should be, but I am able to breathe comfortably. I normally wear a 38C bra size, and I ordered an L, but that was too small so i exchanged it for an XL. Fits great now. It is medium support, not suitable for volleyball or intense running and things like that. But is great for normal workouts or light jogging. Looks very nice, too. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied amazon costumer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I am a medium size and fit perfectly. True to size. Would love to get more but no more exist.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L Sutton

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: These are a little tight, but they provide AMAZING support. Something I can't really complain about. Pros - Fits well - they are a little snug but fit well Breathe pretty well - No pools of sweat after the end of a workout don't displace fat too badly - no random bulge underneath Looks nice - No weird profile
customer_reviews.author: Chae

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could have this bra.
customer_reviews.text: Just can't chance it though. Might still not fit and I'd have to go through all the return stuff again. I wear medium and since comments said it ran small I got a large. Managed to squeeze into it but I looked like a Marie Antoinette wanna-be and I could barely breath. Someone at Champion is not doing their job, like fixing such an obvious faux-pas in sizing. Won't take a chance on this company again unless I'm in the store with their product and a dressing room. Which I really try to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: paulamarie

customer_reviews.title: Runs small - make sure to order a size up
customer_reviews.text: It's my own fault for not seeing that they "run small" right next to the sizes that you select, so I ended up returning mine. I'm a 38D and the large didn't have enough material to cover everything. Depending on what other reviewers say, if it shrinks in the wash, I'd even suggest buying 2 sizes up. Other than that, the material was nice and sturdy and it fit comfortably enough (even though it was too small for me).
customer_reviews.author: Saldelmaz

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bra. I normally wear a Medium but after ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bra. I normally wear a Medium but after reading other reviews decided to go with an XL. I wear it for yoga, zumba and step classes and it doesn't ride up like one of my other bras does. It washes nicely, but I hang it to dry rather than putting it in the dryer. Plan on getting a couple more! Just remember, order a size (or 2) up.
customer_reviews.author: Lab Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the back ache.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good sports bra, but it comes REALLY small. I read the reviews and ordered a size larger and it's STILL too small. It's very tight around the bust. It holds my breasts well, but wearing it for an hour and it hurts and leaves marks in my skin. Had I known it would have run THAT small I never would have bought it. When you order larger they don't actually make the band bigger, they just make the 'cups' bigger so it will hold larger breasts, but it won't fit very well around your chest. Getting it on is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Sports bras, unless you're large-busted, are really pretty generic. Buy these a size larger, they run small. I bought my 14-year old daughter a medium...went up a size based on other reviews. She is 5'4" 115lbs and not fully developed up top, she normally wears a small. She is a competitive swimmer and sprinter for the track team. She said the top is a little tight under the chest, but it is comfortable and she's been wearing them to practice without complaint.
customer_reviews.author: KAD

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Small.  Seriously!
customer_reviews.text: I am a medium when I wear most things. I'm a size 10 generally, 5'7", about a 34B or 36B depending. I ordered a medium because I wanted something extra firm for running. What I got was a bra that I couldn't breathe in, and that seriously pinched my armpits. I tried again with a Large, and I do use that now... I wear it for the under 1 hour that I run because it really does hold everything in place extremely well, but I take it off immediately when I'm done because it just isn't very comfortable. It still feels small, and still pinches my armpits a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: My go to
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 36D (43bust, 35waist), and typically I would get a L in sports bra just hold everything down. I like this enough that I'm ordering another one, but this time an XL since I've gained a little weight, the Large cuts into my ribs and back fat. It supports enough for me to run and other cardio. The band on the bottom sometimes flips up when I'm running, but I think that's because the L is too small on me.
customer_reviews.author: corina

customer_reviews.title: It knocked those humps out of my chest and apparently into my back.
customer_reviews.text: I know it's supposed to hold the girls in, but I don't like slithering into something that is typically my size, only to discover my ta-tas are missing and I now have enough back rolls to make up for it if I spin my head 180 degrees. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mellott

customer_reviews.title: Does what the maker says, and oes it well.
customer_reviews.text: On time and as advertised. What more can you ask for such a garment and producer?
customer_reviews.author: Ron Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and good side coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for under any bathing suit that doesn't have enough coverage on the sides. Very strong material.
customer_reviews.author: Cosme

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up as this style runs small; coverage is still decent
customer_reviews.text: I run frequently and was looking for some new sports bras. I thought I'd try this out as the price was relatively decent. I have a thin-average frame with a 36D bust and wear a Large in all other sports bras. I tried this bra on and it was surprisingly tight. The coverage seemed okay, just tight in the back. I hand washed it as not to shrink it and plan to test it out in the gym tomorrow to see if it will work for lighter work-outs. I recommend ordering a size up.
customer_reviews.author: SoonerMel

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive
customer_reviews.text: Size Up if you don't want to have a workout just by putting it on, Great for running it gives a lot of compression and the wide bottom band keeps girls in place, if you are like me and aren't an athlete Size up for ease of slipping it on, I got a medium (I'm 34C) I should have ordered a L . The length of the straps is great, it's short so adds it lift . material is substantial it gives but it's thick .
customer_reviews.author: Lina10

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I like my sports bras tight , so I did not heed the reviews. Mistake! This was tighter than could be comfortable, exacerbated by the fact that it was too short. The bottom band did not sit comfortably below my breasts, but smashed the bottoms of them. Should have listened to the other reviews. I am a 36C, and sent back the mediums for larges. These run SMALL. Order at least one size up. Quality seems to be good, and they look like they will last with normal washing care (not putting them in the dryer, cold wash, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: S. Edington

customer_reviews.title: Bright, but MUCH smaller then previous generation of same style!
customer_reviews.text: I have many of the Absolute Workout Bras and they've been fantastic. I've lost quite a lot of weight and, as a result, my bust has shrunk. I ordered this bra, in the next size down, and I couldn't get it on! When I placed it with the next size up there was about 3.5 - 4 inches in between the bottom chest band on the bras! Much more then there should be between sizes! I've exchanged it for the next size up, to compare and will update my review when it arrives...
customer_reviews.author: erinsan

customer_reviews.title: too small get a following size
customer_reviews.text: This champion woman's absolute workout sports bra is okay. For women who like being tight . I do, but this Bra was a bit too tight, lol... that made tight marks on my skin. Still use it but not for a very long time. But brand is very good, if going to buy i suggest a next size. I wouldn't buy it again. The brand and material is good though.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy :)

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I am not a large chested person, I don't think. I am a size 32 D - the victim of a later in life growth spurt, and I'm very used to being small chested - and I thought a medium would fit just fine because my rib cage is very small, i wear size small in shirts. I had to send this back. I may try a large, but I think I honestly need to go to a store to try on a bunch of sports bras first to find my size.
customer_reviews.author: GHL

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I knew from the reviews that it wouldn’t fit as expected so I knew it would be tight(which was what I wanted) I’m a 32 DDD so I needed a lot of support. I got a small and it’s perfect, tight enough to have tons of support and a good material. If u want it to be less tight I probably would’ve gotten a medium but I knew exactly what I want from this bra.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Comfy if a bit low cut.
customer_reviews.text: The bra definitely holds me in tight! The only problem is that the top is a little looser than the band part and the cut is lower than I was hoping for, so I feel like I might fall out when I'm not standing upright, although it could just be because I have a short torso, so the straps are just a bit too long for me. The bra is very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I am tall and have a hard time finding sports bras that fit if they don't have adjustable straps. I have a couple that are similar in style to this one and they fit perfect, sadly, this one did not. I like the fabric and style, if the straps would have had more stretch to them it would have worked. They are priced very well.
customer_reviews.author: MinRose

customer_reviews.title: not as good as the ones of the same brand I bought at costco
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and bought one size bigger than my usual sports bras but it's still very very tight. The fabric is ok but on the stiffer side compared to the ones I bought at Costco. I'm gonna keep this one but will not buy again. Hopefully as time goes by the fabric will go a bit looser.
customer_reviews.author: Meao

customer_reviews.title: perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about getting a sports bra online but I was pleasantly surprised with this purchase. The bra is a great price and actually is very supportive! I am a 34c, usually wear a small but I followed the other reviews and went with a size up and got the medium . Perfect fit!! I am very happy with my purchase and I will be buying more colors in the near future:) I'm off to the gym right now!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Gina

customer_reviews.title: not the best I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I was really apprehensive about ordering this bra due to the varying size reviews, according to the size chart I should be a small, however I ordered a medium it fits perfectly. (I am 5 ft 119lbs and a 34 B) I used this run on Sunday for one of my long runs (15 miles) and it offered moderate support...not the best I've tried, however it stayed in place for the whole run and I didn't have any chaffing
customer_reviews.author: Salina Style

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the bra is great--but it fit so ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the bra is great--but it fit so tight! I mean, just really tight around my rib cage (not bust area). I would have a hard time taking deep breaths! I couldn't return them, as I'd worn them a few times, so I gave them to a few friends who were more petite than me. Hopefully they can use them!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany from South Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple sports bra--order a size or two up
customer_reviews.text: Love this sports bra so much I ordered more! Very simple and straightforward, supportive, and comfortable. I took the advice of many posters here and ordered up a size--I am petite and have an athletic build so usually wear extra small or small, but also have a big rib-cage (usually wear a 38-A bra). I ended up getting a medium and it fits excellently. So while it fit as I expected based on other comments, I'd second the recommendation to order up.
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: Quality is really nice. Been wearing for over a year
customer_reviews.text: Size runs small, order a size bigger. Quality is really nice. Been wearing for over a year. Washes up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn_Dex

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a compression bra
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 30E bra (b/c I have a small waist and med breast size) but I still order med or large for this type of sports bra. It is very tight and can have a yucky armpit overflow look if you order it too small. Most ladies wer the wrong bra size so make sure you measure properly before gauging with reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Selling Girls sizesas Womens sizes
customer_reviews.text: I don't complain much ...but.. I ordered these Sports Bras for me...I am 5' tall, weight 110lbs ... I wear a size extra small to small women... I could not get these sports bras passed my knees...but ...they fit my 10 year old Granddaughter (who is 3'2" and weights around 65lbs) very snuggly...so I gave them to her ... I reordered size Medium and just put one on... I could barely get it on and it is digging into my armpits ... I will give these to my other young skinny Granddaughter...and OH... I WILL NOT ever buy from Champion again...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have 36D breasts and have a decently difficult time finding the perfect sports bra. This one is pretty good, although I might have been better off getting a large (I usually get mediums for the extra tight hold), due to the elastic band at the bottom, which has a grip feel to it and it harder to get on and off compared to a fabric covered band. Great quality though and happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jacelyn

customer_reviews.title: Great sports bra - just order one size up!
customer_reviews.text: I took advice from the reviews and ordered a size up. I am 5'7" - 120lbs - size 34D - I usually buy a M in sports bras so I ordered a L. It fits perfectly - I haven't tested it out in the gym yet but "the girls" felt secure yet comfy when I tried it on at home. The color is a awesome bright pink. I am very happy with this product, especially for the price! I plan on buying more!
customer_reviews.author: nhjya

customer_reviews.title: Needed something for running
customer_reviews.text: Never bought a sports bra before, but needed something for running to prevent annoying bouncing. The sports bra fit perfectly, however after using it for one day I found out the seems were cutting into my sides a bit too much. I kept using it, to see if that feeling would change. I'm happy to say that it did! After washing it once and wearing it again, the seems did not bug me at all. I wore this sports bra for an entire day during a 100 mile relay race, with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Su

customer_reviews.title: Also - the bra and the band around the bottom are two different materials - so the band was super tight where as the rest was ab
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a mesium in this type of bra, but found that it was too small. Also - the bra and the band around the bottom are two different materials - so the band was super tight where as the rest was about right. I'm usually a 36B in regular bras, so maybe this style is designed for women with bigger cup sizes. For me, the champion feedom seamless bra is definitely the way to go - I LOVE that bra.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I am fit, 5'5", 132 lb, with a 36 C bust. I ordered a med in this bra which is what I normally get for a somewhat snug fit. I could barely squeeze myself into this. There is not a whole lot of elasticity with this one so it was nearly impossible to get on and more so to get off. I also felt that the coverage area of the front was less than others sports bras I have, so getting a large probably still wouldn't suit my body. This might be better suited for women with a smaller chest but did not work for me. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Engels

customer_reviews.title: Great for binding
customer_reviews.text: To all my fellow queers: this bra makes every button down I own suddenly fit perfectly. No gaping and the top button close without any problem. I have 34B cups and ordered a M and this bra binds quite nicely, better than any I have ever owned. And it's cheap and seems to be good quality and is quite comfy. Not sure how it would work for binding larger chests, but for B cups and smaller I highly recommend this sports bra.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good price, though
customer_reviews.text: Reading some of the reviews prior to purchasing online, I knew it was going to be a little more snug. I'm 36C, opted for the large and it wound up being a bit tight around the ribs. It does hold everything in really well and likely would be good for running, but it's not the best for yoga when you want to expand your ribs more for deep breathing. I do feel it will stretch out over time and I will continue to wear it, but it's not my top choice sports bra in my wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Angelfire82

customer_reviews.title: runs very small
customer_reviews.text: All of my sports bras are extra larges and they fit perfectly. While the support is excellent, it's not something I can wear all day or even for several hours. I put it on in the morning, and about 10 hours later I regretted it. I can probably still use it to run to a workout class and change afterwards. It seems to be very durable though. Only complaint is about the size. Hopefully, I'll be able to fit into it better soon!
customer_reviews.author: jinabee77

customer_reviews.title: The material is comfortable. If I could decide again I may have ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 34D, 120 pounds and 5'5", but I have big shoulders and a small waist. I ordered the large and it fits well, it's just a little big on the bottom. The material is comfortable. If I could decide again I may have gone with the medium, but then i think it would have been to tight on my shoulders. Overall, I like it, it's not see through, nor do your nipples show. I haven't worked out in it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a 32C but I'm pregnant so I'm kind of between that and a 32D at the moment. I ordered the medium and it fits perfect, that is the size I buy in most brands. If this bra were any tighter in the band, I'd have trouble breathing. It provides the correct amount of support based on the product description. It looks nice also.
customer_reviews.author: Karli

customer_reviews.title: medium is TIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered a large. I'm an athletic 34D, and the medium was WAY too small. The bottom band is intense: tight and no give. I'd say 32 would be about right for a medium. I could use this for a jogging bra if it wasn't so uncomfortable around the rib cage. I'm going to return for large. I gave it three stars because it is made well and I wish it fit!
customer_reviews.author: kari

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sports bra I have ever bought. Usually when I buy them they stretch out after a month and no longer fit right. I started with one and had to buy 4 more because this is my favorite bra to wear. The first one I bought I've had for 4 months and hasn't started to lose its shape at all
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was the same as the Champion sports bra carried in a two pack at Costco. It is not. The material is different, the Costco one feels like cotton while this one feels like Lycra. I like this one ok and it does the job but it fits a bit more snug that I like. Since I bought several of these bras to use while bike riding and walking, I expect the tight fit to go away as I lose weight.
customer_reviews.author: AprilWhine

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: Love these bras, but the fit around the ribs was somewhat smaller than I expected. They keep me nice and strapped down while I work out, but the small band makes them kinda hard to get on and off, and sometimes hurt just a little.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn  Dawid

customer_reviews.title: Why pay for a name brand? Great quality here.
customer_reviews.text: Great for me. I'm a 36 DD and I ordered large. I like a lot of support. I ordered two and I am very happy with my purchase. Fabric is of good quality, seem like it will last. Very good for the price I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Hoffpauir

customer_reviews.title: Fits fine, exposed elastic
customer_reviews.text: This fits like my other Champion sports bras, not a lot of support but enough for the gym. My only problem with this is the exposed elastic on the band, which makes it less comfortable than a bra with covered elastic. Oh well, it works well enough to use when my other sports bras are in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B

customer_reviews.title: Decent for price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a budget-friendly, high-impact bra. I'm 32B and got a medium as recommended. It's a little loose in the chest but a small might have suffocated me because the band is tight. I find the material a little chaffing so it definitely won't be my go-to bra for long workouts, but for the price it is a decent quality bra. Likely wouldn't buy again though.
customer_reviews.author: RoyalSmash

customer_reviews.title: I know they should be worn tight but this is so uncomfortable and feels like it is cutting off my circulation
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a medium top but bought a large size sport bra. I know they should be worn tight but this is so uncomfortable and feels like it is cutting off my circulation. I think I can stretch it out so I will be able to wear it in the future. The quality of the material s good.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna R. Gillen

customer_reviews.title: ... sport bras for years and they still are the best fitting and most comfortable for tennis and exercise
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing champion sport bras for years and they still are the best fitting and most comfortable for tennis and exercise. I will stick with Champion because every time I try to order another brand they are either too big or too little. It's too hard to try to order som other brand online.
customer_reviews.author: darby21

customer_reviews.title: Not very supportive for running
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fit when used for running. I do not recommend you use it for running, I would recommend you use it for simple work outs nothing extreme like running or intensive cardio routines. Keeps breast in place but doesn't feel extremely supportive. Good material and I would highly recommend hand washing not machine washing, maybe on delicate cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Vane

customer_reviews.title: Went to target and bought a Medium and it fit fine. I am sue it is a fine bra
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 year old and it didn't even go through her shoulders. She is tiny, may be a 32A. We couldn't even slide it down below shoulder line. Get a size up or two if you are ordering. Went to target and bought a Medium and it fit fine. I am sue it is a fine bra, but we couldn't even try it on. So I will give 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: E

product_meta.title: Champion Women's Absolute Workout Sport Bra
product_meta.description: The Absolute workout II: solids and prints at a great value. A must have for any gym bag.
feature_bullets: Moisture management technology helps keep you cool and dry
Soft, brushed-elastic band adds comfort and support
Tag-free racerback design allows freedom of movement
